intro: Convolvulus boerhavii, commonly known as the yellow field bindweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring creeping stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow, funnel-shaped flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open fields, along roadsides, and in disturbed areas. Convolvulus boerhavii is known for its rapid growth and can become invasive in certain environments.
